Stayed a few nights
review_text: The place was perfect for my fiancé and I! It was beautiful,clean,homey quiet,peaceful and well located. Janice & Mike had the house stocked with every detail possible you can think of. From shampoo to a lighter in the drawer! Mike greeted us when we got there. He was very nice and helpful! They even left us a gift card to a local bakery! How sweet is that? Our event got canceled on Sunday. We decided to get some food and have a night in the Airbnb. We enjoyed our stay! We will be back when we are back in Louisville and we will recommend to all friends and family. Thank you for having us!

review_text: We really liked this place. It was very tastefully decorated, clean, and had a welcoming, relaxing vibe. A well stocked kitchen and lists of amenities. We didn’t have to communicate much with the hosts once we arrived because everything was so good. Air traffic was a bit noisy one night but I did notice they even had ear plugs available if you needed them. A few restaurants close by and a great location in the central area of Louisville. My only regret is that we couldn’t stay longer. I would definitely recommend this place.

They responded quickly every time. Great information in the folder to help you find exactly what you’re looking for in surrounding areas. The home itself was very comfortable and homey feeling. Everything you could need for a short or long trip was accessible. Highly recommend

name: Alicia
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I you happen to be visiting Louisville, KY - especially if you have family attending Univ. of Kentucky, you will want to stay here! It's literally down the street! You are less than 5 minutes from the highway, there a restaurants you can walk to - even one that has live music! There is a bakery and coffee shop right across the street! The Place is in a quiet neighborhood. We felt safe and slept great! The back yard has a fire pit and a grill with seating, very private. Inside was very clean and spacious. I love the pocket doors to the bathroom and the sliding barn door to the bedroom. The shower was AMAZING! It's huge and has a rain fall shower head..there is no way you do not feel clean coming out of there. The living area and kitchen were open and had everything we needed. Mike met us and showed how to lock up and where everything was kept. Janice and Mike were great hosts! You will not be disappointed staying here!.

Stayed about a week
review_text: I can’t say enough about The Place! I used to come to Louisville regularly for business (pre-pandemic) and fell in love with this spot when I stumbled on it. I was thrilled to see it was available for this week’s last-minute trip. Mike met me at The Place to remind me of the nuances I might have forgotten since my last stay. I was immediately pleased to discover their AirBNB was just as clean and inviting as it had been on my prior visits. This hidden gem is a 5-10 minute Uber rides to most anywhere you want to be in Louisville. It features very convenient on-property parking and super-clean EVERYTHING. I highly recommend staying here if you’re in need of a cool spot in Louisville.

review_text: Great location, fantastic hosts! Everything was as pictured in the listing. Host even reached out ahead of time to arrange to meet us at check in. They also provided great recommendations, and some tasty snacks. Even left us a gift card for the bakery across the street. Go early! Great central location to access the many different offerings the city provides. This is a city, you will hear noise, from airplanes, to traffic, to outside passer by's but we felt safe and secure, and enjoyed having the private backyard area. Comfortable furniture, including bed! We will be back if ever in the area.

review_text: the place is actually bigger than what it looks in the picts, it had 2 toilets ,a great shower,they provided shampoo, conditioner & body wash liquid, it even had a washer /dryer ,iron & ironing board which I did use,the kitchen was full size,the bathroom was great, the bed was comfortable, a lot of lighting and a patio outside,Mr Mike explained everything about the house upon arrival, meet us outside and handed us the key ,my friend Slept in a air mattress & had no issues, all the linnen,towels where provided & extra blanket & pillows ,very satisfied with this ,plus easy to go to downtown Louisville a block away taking the #28 bus northbound ,a great donut shop across the st ,a white castle,Walgreens & dollar general a block away ,highly recommend it .

Snacks were a nice touch, as was a gift certificate for the yummy bakery across the street. Would stay here again if visiting Louisville!

Our hosts were very responsive and even met us when we arrived, showed us around and helped carry our bags in. Top notch experience!

rating_info:

,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: We stayed for nine days over Christmas and found the place to be excellent. The lodging is much more spacious than the photos would suggest, with a large well stocked kitchen and ample living space. The bed was comfortable, and there were plenty of spare linen and towels. The bathroom had a large shower area and included a walk in closet area to hang clothes, additional space to the chest of drawers in the bedroom. There was no shortage of mirrors and the entire apartment was well lit. Mike who met us on check in and walked us through the place is an excellent host, and super responsive. Part of our stay included a major snow storm and he was by after the storm had passed to clear the snow and was thoughtful enough to bring us a snow scraper. All in all this was an excellent visit for us made more enjoyable by "The Place."

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The Place was comfortable, well- appointed, and in a location convenient to my weekend plans. Mike met me upon my arrival to show me where to park and to give me a quick tour of The Place. I appreciated the little touches like snacks, cinnamon bread, soft drinks, coffee, and bottled water. There were several hand written pages with all Janice & Mike’s local favorites. The Place was warm, inviting, and decorated nicely. The air conditioning worked great, the bed was comfortable, the shower was huge with hot water and good water pressure, and the towels were big and soft. Even though The Place is a unique converted store front on a main street, it was very homey and I heard very little traffic. The back patio was an added bonus and was private and inviting. All in all it was a great Airbnb and perfect for my weekend stay!

review_text: We loved our stay here. Mike and Janice are exceptional hosts. When Mike greeted us we walked into a beautiful space with music playing and fresh flowers throughout . The bed was very comfortable and there were extra blankets, sheets and comforters for extra comfort. The bathroom is sleek in design with a huge shower and extra large, very soft towels plus additional supplies if you may forget anything. The kitchen is great and we were given a delicious loaf of cinnamon swirl coffee cake. Coffee was provided and so many extras came with the space. We loved the outdoor space and enjoyed watching the family of bunnies living under the hostas and seeing a variety of birds while having morning coffee on the covered swing. Overall a beautifully designed and decorated space with so many thoughtful touches and details. The absolute best Airbnb and hosts! Thank you so much Mike and Janice you made our stay amazing!

What a great stay we had at The Place. It's immaculate, thoughtfully designed and stocked and so convenient to so many restaurants and breweries. Mike met us upon arrival to walk us through and give us insight and tips for our stay. We were an hour past our original planned arrival time due to weather and traffic on our drive, and Mike was understanding and patient as we kept him updated. Janice left pages of recommendations for local restaurants and pubs, and they also provided cinnamon bread, snacks, bottled water and sodas.
The bed was so comfortable, the shower spacious and the full kitchen spotless. Can't recommend the location enough. We hope to return to Louisville for another weekend getaway and would definitely book The Place again if we have the opportunity.

review_text: This is one of the best Airbnb’s I have ever stayed at! It is in the perfect quiet location - close to the airport, downtown tourist attractions, an awesome coffee shop, and delicious donuts. I also loved all of the extra added touches that made the place feel more like home. I especially appreciated the fluffy bath sheets, comfy bed with high thread count bedding, the amazing shower, and the well stocked kitchen. I was also thankful for Janice and Mike being so understanding as my plane to KY was delayed and then eventually cancelled. After many messages back and forth, I finally arrived around midnight and Mike still met me at the apartment to show me around. This was greatly appreciated after a long and stressful day of traveling. I highly recommend Janice and Mike’s Airbnb! I can guarantee that you will have an awesome stay!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place was the perfect location for us to visit our sons for Thanksgiving weekend and be able to have a home away from home experience...and so much more. The place is perfect. It's much larger than the pictures show and very trendy and clean. It reminds me of my lofted condo in Chicago. The extra touches they put in to it, you can tell they really care about their guests stay. The shower is extremely large and on a cold day, very difficult to leave. I was able to cook an entire Thanksgiving meal in the spacious kitchen that has many amenities to use. I also shared with Mike that we would have an extra guest for dinner and he made sure to have an extra chair as well as plates for our guest. The set up allowed us to enjoy our family time together. We will be staying again on our next visit through Louisville. It is also extremely convenient to all of Louisville, especially to get to Bardstown Road stores and restaurants. Thank you for a great time Mike and Janice! You made our Thanksgiving very special for us this year!

It just enriched my feeling of being at home. The bed was comfortable, towels were high quality and soft. The home was sparkling clean and fresh. You cannot go wrong staying here. It’s an amazing find! Just do me a favor and don’t book it for the time when I make a return trip!
Thank you so much Janice and Mike!
Rich Konkler
The Imagist Gallery

There are tons of little extra touches like snacks, water, soft drinks, coffee & tea, and extra toiletries, plus a lovely little picnic basket left for our use if we wanted it. The apartment itself is gorgeous - beautifully decorated, spectacularly clean, a washer and dryer, lots of extra linens and towels if needed, and the bathroom is magical. We visit Louisville fairly often and will absolutely keep Janice and Mike’s place in mind for next time. It’s easy proximity to downtown, the Highlands, Bardstown Road, and quick and easy Uber/Lyft service to anywhere in town if you don’t want to drive. We loved it!

It was that perfect mix of lots-to-do yet quiet residential area that felt very safe. I felt right at home in Laura's place, as it had everything I needed and was well-decorated and uncluttered. I can't recommend it enough, and will most definitely be back.

Laura's place was the perfect home base. She provides a sheet of nearby suggestions so you don't have to spend your relaxation time doing neighborhood research. Walk a couple of minutes, and you can browse cool stores and eat tasty food, and for a $10 Uber ride (or an even more affordable bus trip), you can be downtown. Super convenient! Our favorite aspects of this stay were how easy it is to communicate with Laura; how precious and quirky her space is; fun & thoughtful amenities she provides guests; and a bed that helped us get a good night's sleep. We would definitely return.

Stayed with kids
review_text:
My thirteen year-old nephew and I enjoyed our two-night stay here during a spring break trip to Louisville. The cottage is nicely tucked away in a backyard patio and had everything we needed for a short trip to the area. Space is tight for two, but he loved tucking away for bed up in the loft and the mini-kitchen's fridge, sink and microwave were adequate for our breakfast prep. The loft bed and futon were comfortable and the bathroom was clean and nicely appointed.
If you are traveling solo, the cottage is perfect. If you are a two-person party who can be in a small space together, this will work well.
Lisa is a lovely host and proactively stopped by at check in to make sure everything was okay. She also gave us some helpful suggestions for area restaurants and activities.

review_text:
I honestly chose for the most value for a week-long stay. What I didn’t anticipate was the intimacy of their travel trinkets, their well-read community books, and the love that went into building this little carriage house.
I used the space to recover from a medical procedure, it offered the ease of access that I needed, and the peacefulness that I wanted.
You can tell that this is more than just a passive income for these hosts, but a part of their heart and travels that they enjoy sharing with other travelers.
I greatly appreciated the hospitality and transparency in communication. And will be happy to save this one for future visits as it is so well-suited for my travel needs in Louisville.
Not to mention Heine Bros (one of my favorite coffee shops) was only 100ft away! Beyond convenient and laughable.
☀️

review_text: Staying at this Airbnb was a wonderful experience. The place was easy to find and instructions about the place were very clear. The outside sitting area was very comfortable. There were birds singing in the morning, very peaceful 🙂. The place was small, but space was well utilized and organized. It was even comfortable for the tall person I came with. The loft didn't have a mattress, but understandable based on size. So the loft had a portable mattress pad. The futon was pretty comfortable. The fridge was stocked full of snacks and drinks. There was cooking equipment available. There were so many restaurants, a few coffee shops and ice cream places within walking distance. The host was very kind and knowledgeable about the area. Next time I am in Louisville, I will definitely be back.

Lisa and her husband were excellent hosts! I was a little disappointed to see that the there was not a real mattress. I was under the impression that the loft bed had a real mattress, but it was more of a hard foam situation (I honestly don’t know). The other option for sleeping is a futon. If you are good with that, then this place is great and I would stay again.
It’s in a great location and walking distance to coffee shops and restaraunts and plenty of street parking. It’s also very clean and well taken care of! For me the bed situation didn’t outweigh all of the pros, but I’m also picky!! I would definitely recommend for a quick, one night stay. I just want other to be aware of the sleeping arrangements but other than that 5 stars!

Location was excellent—walkable to grocery as well as local coffee, restaurants, & shops—and carriage house & courtyard were absolutely lovely. Hosts were friendly and available but not at all intrusive, and the little convenience snacks & beverages were thoughtful. WiFi was great, very functional spaces to sleep, work, eat, & lounge, and no issues with self check-in. Rain shower head was an unexpected perk. Just an overall enjoyable stay!

review_text: Reserved this stay as it seemed like a truly unique experience - and it lived up to our expectations! We spent the morning in downtown Louisville exploring distilleries. The property was an easy 15 minute drive and we had absolutely no problems thanks to Don and Ron's proactive messaging and very thorough manual/guide! We got to meet their lovely dog Finch and learn all about this amazing piece of history. The surrounds are so peaceful and relaxing, and the restoration/preservation of this historic cabin is a joy to see and also provides all the modern comforts you need. The screened in porch is great, and there are a number of other areas to relax and enjoy the view. A true gem for antique lovers, history lovers, dog and nature lovers. My only regret is that we only booked one night.

I brought my son on a trip for his spring break and we loved our stay in this historic cabin (so much so that I am already figuring out when I can make it back to town with my fiancée).
The surrounding grounds are beautiful and everything is exactly as it looks in the photographs - it was like stepping back in time (except with better plumbing and HVAC systems).
The cabin’s decor was tastefully done, the bed and other furniture were comfortable, and the kitchen and bath were well appointed. It was also very quiet.
Communication with Donald was excellent, and the guest book has good information on the history of the property along with local recommendations. (I can confirm that the brewery recommendation is spot on.) Finally, I enjoyed meeting his friendly and very well behaved dog!

I’m sorry that we only had one night at this property! Donald is a very responsive host. We arrived later than expected and he still arranged to meet us & provide a quick tour before leaving us to settle in. The cabin was immaculately clean. Furnishings have been meticulously chosen, suiting the historic feel of the cabin while being comfortable for guests. The bed & bedding were perfect (thank you for the tip on where to buy those sheets! 😊). Donald thoughtfully provided snacks & coffee pods, which we enjoyed on the screened-in porch. The grounds are serenely beautiful. When we saw Donald in the morning, he shared some future plans for the property. We hope to return again to spend some more time enjoying the cabin, the grounds, and the area around Louisville.
Almost forgot: our host provided a detailed list of places to dine, and his recommendations were on point! Highland Morning was our choice for breakfast, and Mussels and Burgers for dinner.
Thank you for a great stay!

review_text: The only thing more charming than the pristine cabin were the hosts! The collection of art on the property and immaculate eye for detail immersed us instantly into this gem neatly tucked away in Louisville. The hosts were gracious and helpful and made our stay more incredible than we could’ve imagined! Their recommendations for fine dining were tailored to our tastes and on point! We arrived after sunset and were enchanted by strands of lights that cast a whimsical and mediterranean feel on brick and stone patio. We appreciated the level of attention that had gone into the perfectly manicured grounds. The sounds and sights of the fountain in pond were nothing short of magical. The property was overflowing with a rich tapestry of history and culture. The bed in the cabin was the most comfortable I’ve ever slept in! The grounds were beautiful as well, and we really enjoyed exploring the property. The freshly cut wild flowers from the owner’s garden were a great touch. The hosts were very friendly, helpful, and hospitable… always wanting to make sure that our stay was the best that it could be. The owners two dogs were very friendly greeters as well … beautiful members of their family. Great place, great hosts, and great stay! We really look forward to our return.

All of the comments were five star, as are his reviews, and I add my own. This Airbnb is quiet and comfortable with a bed so soft I happily overslept. I have to say someone did a great job decorating the place. The photos are real. The Germantown neighborhood is in the heart of Louisville, minutes from everything and the neighborhood is walkable with interesting and varied amenities all around. Thanks for everything Bryan and I'll be back!

review_text: This place exceeded my expectations. The space was beautiful, large, comfortable, very thoughtfully arranged. The instructions from Bryan were clear, it was easy to find, and private. The hosts were welcoming without being intrusive. They were responsive. Airbnb can feel very transactional now, but this was a great experience. It felt like how Airbnb was designed - kind and caring people welcoming you into their home. The guest book had local recommendations, and there were more in literature on the coffee table. It was also refreshing to have a minimal check out list. Would highly recommend staying here.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This guest house is truly a 10/10.
Lots of space inside. Two of us worked remotely for three days inside and there was plenty of room for us spread out. Fast wifi. The bed was large and comfy. The TV is massive. Very well decorated and cohesive look inside. I love the tile in the bathroom and around the fireplace!
Germantown is the best area of Louisville. Tons to walk to including a grocery store just a couple minutes away. Lots of people walking their dogs and riding bikes. Great restaurants and bars nearby you can walk to. Very centrally located if you need to Uber/Lyft to anything.
Bryan and Alexandra checked in with us regularly, we’re very fast to respond, and we’re the kind of hosts you hope you get every time you stay somewhere. Thank you both for being so great!
I would absolutely stay here again.

You are an easy walk from numerous restaurants and bars, only a 10 minute drive to the airport, yet it was quiet and peaceful. Ample street parking as well. 6 stars!

It is located very near the Muhammed Ali Center, the Louisville Slugger Museum & Factory, and the Kentucky Science Center. There is great shopping and dining within walking distance on Main Street . The owners were gracious and helpful. We met Diane one of the co-owners, as we were leaving for our next destination, - she was very kind and pleasant. The entire building including the public spaces is truly a unique boutique, experience!

It’s also near the highway if you happen to need it. You can hear the cars if you’re a light sleeper, but I sleep with a noise machine so it didn’t bother me. Overall, it was the perfect getaway while in Louisville! Thank you Patti and Diane!

review_text: This place is spotless, had a variety of teas and coffee available (we are tea drinkers, so this was so appreciated) and had so many amenities on site! The gym was beautiful and I used it each morning. The courtyard was also gorgeous. We tried to go to dinner across the street the first night and realized that there was no availability because Jim Gaffigan was in town and was performing at the Palace. That was about a block and a half away (on the same street). So, we bought tickets 30 minutes before the show and had a great time. Then, we walked to the beautiful wine store just down the road and had a lovely dinner after the show back at the apartment. The next day, we walked to the Louisville slugger museum (about a mile away). Thanks for an excellent stay!

A couple amenities that I really appreciated were the fan in the bedroom ( unexpected but greatly appreciated by someone who sleeps with a fan every night), the travel sized shampoo conditioner and soap, and coffee! My husband and I walked to 4th street live for food, drinks, and entertainment each day we were there. We would definitely stay here again next time we visit Louisville. Thank you!

The neighborhood felt safe, parking was easy, and within walking distance we found a great coffee shop (Quill’s) and had an awesome brunch (Biscuit Belly). Instructions were very clear for check-in and check-out. I was mostly impressed with the binder in the unit that included safety notes, check-in and check-out instructions, and a thorough run-down on local recommendations from bars to restaurants to parks and other activities. Oliver clearly takes pride in hosting his place, and it shows.

review_text: This was one of the best airbnb experiences we have ever had, and we've stayed in quite a few. Oliver was so responsive and checked in with us to make sure we had everything we needed, which we did. The guide book in the unit was awesome and provided excellent restaurant and other recommendations. The apartment was extremely clean and comfortable (and I'm pretty nit-picky). The shower was great and the bed was sooo comfortable. The kitchenette had everything we needed, including a microwave, mini-fridge, Keurig machine, coffee and creamer. The location is fantastic. It's on a quiet, tree-lined residential street that is a five minute walk to great coffee shops, cute boutiques and a variety of restaurants. We can't wait to return!

The location on a quiet, tree-lined residential street, yet so close to be able to walk to a wide array of restaurants, coffee shops, microbreweries, independent shops, and the like was perfect for exploring Butchertown and NuLu on foot. Street parking was easy and close. Great communication and easy to follow house manual and neighborhood guide were excellent.
Highly recommended!

The unit does not have a full kitchen, but I didn’t plan to cook, so that was OK. The hosted are very responsive to any questions and helpful.

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Great location. Very clean. Attentive host.
Butchertown neighborhood has everything within a couple of blocks: great restaurants, cute shops and a liquor store.
Parked our car (on the street around the corner there is plenty of free parking) and never moved it, because we walked everywhere.
Walked 30 minutes to the farthest distillery, Peerless Distilling, highly recommended. Hit all of them on the way back: Michters, Evan Williams, Old Forester, and Angel’s Envy. The final distillery, Rabbit Hole is only a few blocks from home.
Several breweries within walking distance, too.
Had a minor issue. Emailed the host and he solved it within minutes.
Would stay here again.

rating_info:

,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We got in on Friday evening and left Monday morning. We couldn't have asked for a better experience and place for our first Airbnb stay. Karen & Bryan were very communicative from the start and answered all my questions. The description and pictures of the carriage house could NOT be more accurate. It was perfect for a long weekend, but would also be great for much longer stays as there's pretty much anything you could need. We were even able to do laundry before we left so we could bring clean clothes home! We also loved that it was a stand-alone unit, and we had the garage as well. The ONLY thing I would caution renters of (and suggest that it be added to the description) is the length limitation for vehicles fitting into the garage. We have a Ford F150 with a 5.5' bed, and we literally only had a few to spare to be able to close the door. It would be worth asking for measurements if you have a pickup or even a longer SUV. Overall, very clean and well-maintained. A+!

review_text: I travel a lot and was so impressed with Karen and Bryan's place. The pictures looked exactly as it was. The location is close to major highways, downtown, gas stations and a Kroger's within minutes which is important when you have a place with a kitchen. Having a garage to park in was great so there was no wondering if I would get a parking space somewhere. There was everything (and more) in the kitchen including a Ninja blender which I used for smoothies. I can't stress enough that this is the place to stay in Louisville. I did have a chance to speak with Bryan and he was extremely friendly, outgoing, and helpful. The kitchen had some spices, cooking spray, tin foil, etc. And in case you may have forgotten something, check the drawer under the bathroom sink, you might find what you need in there. All around, made for a perfect 5-day trip to Louisville. Thank you for having a wonderful place for travelers to stay in your city.

review_text: I stayed at this Airbnb in 2020 & loved it then. Stayed there again this weekend for our anniversary, & have booked it again for two more trips! Great use of space, love the kitchen which has plenty of spices, dishes & cooking pans/blender/ice maker so I was very pleased. Great bed/pillows, plenty of towels, loved the bathroom heater, & two bedside tables w chargers is always a bonus! Restaurant North of Bourbon is 5 min walk—food was good, but service so-so/overpriced for the evening. Everything was 10-15 min from Airbnb which was great! We went Fri night to the Louisville Pumpkin Spectacular (park on side street & walk); Sat to the KY Derby Museum, & then saw comedian Jim Gaffigan at The Louisville Palace (public parking behind Palace $5).

Clean, clean, clean! The most well appointed space, lacking absolutely nothing. Comfortable: feel, vibe, bed, linens, towels. Safe location within walking distance to a slew of restaurants. Only a 10 minute drive to downtown. Private garage to park in. The guidebook they provide is full of wonderful suggestions, several we totally followed. Something else I appreciated was that they had no wacky requirements like some places do. This will be the first place I check for availability the next time we go to Louisville. I suggest it be the same for you!

If you are looking for a great place to stay, located within minutes of downtown and points of interest, this is the place! You won't be disappointed. Highly recommended.

The garage is down a one-lane brick road so the squeeze to park larger cars is pretty tight. I found backing in works best. The apartment is well furnished and beautiful, with some extra touches some hosts wouldn't think to include. The kitchen in particular had everything you could need to cook a good meal. The shower is very luxurious, better than the one I have at home. The apartment is quiet and private, perfect for a cozy night in or for coming back to after a long night out. Give them a go! It was excellent.

The suite itself was just perfect for me and my husband. Plenty of space, super comfortable and while there is some noise from either dogs or the "planes, trains and automobiles", we quickly got used to them (we live next to an airport at home). We did have to leave a day early thanks to the Nor'easter that hit NY, which was a bummer but communication was easy. The bed was comfortable and they helped to make me a sparkling water convert with the extra touches they have in the suite! We highly recommend Karen and Bryan's place and their communication was phenomenal. :-) Thanks for a pleasant stay!

review_text: This was a great place! It had everything you need for a home away from home. It is located in a decent location for you to get around and not have to drive far. It was clean and had so many nice features about it. We came to visit for a motorcycle event we had and the garage was perfect for our two big bikes. When we wanted to go downtown but didn’t want to drive there were electric scooters to rent close by. There is a few good places to eat and drink around the area. We felt safe and that our stuff was safe. The owner’s had excellent communication with everything and were quick with any reply’s. I would definitely recommend this to any friends or family. The price also was perfect for us it was better than a lot of hotel rooms even. If we come back to that area we will be booking with them again.

Check-in was very easy (and it was so nice to have covered/protected parking out of the heat!), and the place is incredibly comfortable and stylishly decorated. It’s definitely in a convenient location to get to Churchill Downs or attractions downtown. We stayed two nights, and on our second night we did have some trouble sleeping due to airplane noises nearby. Just something to keep in mind if you’re particularly light sleepers like we are! There is a white noise machine provided next to the bed, which we appreciated and was a thoughtful touch. Overall a great stay and we’d recommend to anyone looking for accommodations in Louisville!

review_text: The River View was the epitome of serenity. This is a historical location in close proximity to local food, shopping, and attractions. Why stay at a hotel when you can book this beautiful well kept cabin that provides you with everything you could ever need for a peaceful and relaxing experience. Kellie is a wonderful host and makes you feel as if you are in a home away from home. I will absolutely stay here again when I am passing through the area.

review_text: I gave 5 stars only because 10 stars wasn’t an option! This place was amazing. It was secluded, safe, and peaceful. We were in town for the Kentucky Derby. Easy drive in and out, was so nice to out of the hustle and bustle after being at the track all day. The house had everything we needed and then some. Super clean, downstairs bed was comfy- did t stay upstairs and just as described and would 100% stay here again. Kellie checked in on us and made our stay personal to us. Great hostess!

review_text: This home is beyond spectacular!!! I just wish I would have booked it for longer. Every detail has been considered to make your stay perfect. The host, Kellie, was terrific and beyond helpful. The whole house was spotless and well stocked. I even cooked soup and was thrilled to find a peeler for carrots. If you are looking for a peaceful, one of a kind setting this is it. A mile off the paved road, it is a gorgeous, tranquil setting. With two porches, we caught multiple barges driving by on one porch and the sunrise on the other porch. We even spotted a bald eagle over looking the river. Do not hesitate to rent this place. You will not want to leave!
